name: Grape Seed Extract
summary: Grape seed extract is a natural supplement rich in proanthocyanidins (OPCs), studied for its antioxidant, cardiovascular, and neuroprotective effects, with potential benefits for cognition, anxiety, and metabolic health.
description: Grape seed extract (GSE) is derived from the seeds of Vitis vinifera and contains high levels of oligomeric proanthocyanidins (OPCs), which are potent antioxidants. These compounds protect against oxidative stress, improve vascular health, and support microcirculation. Emerging research suggests possible benefits for cognitive function, stress reduction, and adjunctive support in anxiety and metabolic disorders. GSE is commonly used in integrative medicine as a cardiometabolic and neuroprotective supplement.

metadata.fda_status: Dietary supplement (not FDA-approved for medical indications)

contraindications: Allergy to grapes or grape-derived products
monitoring_required: Bleeding risk in patients on anticoagulants

items: Supports cardiovascular health and blood pressure regulation
May improve cognitive performance and memory
Adjunctive support for stress and mild anxiety

sections.text: Grape seed extract is rich in oligomeric proanthocyanidins (OPCs), which exert antioxidant and free radical scavenging effects. These compounds also support nitric oxide production and endothelial function, reducing vascular stiffness and improving circulation. In the CNS, OPCs may reduce neuroinflammation, oxidative stress, and promote synaptic plasticity, potentially improving mood and cognition.

adult.note: Higher doses (up to 600 mg/day) have been used in clinical trials for cardiovascular effects.

sections.text: Vascular and antioxidant effects may be seen within weeks; cognitive and mood benefits require longer-term supplementation.

serious: Bleeding risk in sensitive individuals or those on anticoagulants

other: May increase risk of bleeding in individuals taking anticoagulant or antiplatelet medications.
Limited data in pregnancy and lactation; avoid unless prescribed.

sections.lactation: Avoid due to lack of data
sections.geriatrics: Generally safe at standard doses; monitor for bleeding risk

sections.text: No taper required; may discontinue without withdrawal.

items: Most studied for cardiovascular and vascular health benefits.
Emerging research suggests possible cognitive benefits, but evidence is preliminary.
Rich source of OPCs, similar to pine bark extract (Pycnogenol).

items.label: Sano T, et al. Beneficial effects of grape seed extract on blood pressure and oxidative stress. J Med Food. 2007
Chis IC, et al. Protective effects of grape seed extract in oxidative stress-related conditions. Oxid Med Cell Longev. 2009
National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health – Grape Seed Extract

seo.title: Grape Seed Extract – Antioxidant Supplement for Cardiovascular and Cognitive Health
seo.description: Grape seed extract is a supplement rich in proanthocyanidins, studied for cardiovascular support, antioxidant protection, and potential cognitive and anxiety benefits.
